page.title: 14ELMLEY CASTLE CHURCH
page.content: The Saxon church was extended as the castle of Elmley grew in importance.In the thirteenth century the nave was extended and the tower added.Some Saxon herringbone work can still be seen.In 1340 the north transept(now containing the Savage tomb) and the South aisle were added and the chancel lengthened.In 1544 the height of the north transept was increased.The oak pews were added around 1575.There are excellent examples of Norman,Early English,Perpendicular and Decorated architecture.The font is twelfth century.There is modern controversial painting of the "Pregnant Madonna" by Donald Pass.Minor recent reorder of the interior has opened up the chancel arch.The churchyard contains two sundials from the sixteenth century.
